Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style, possibly patterned, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky brown; exterior: part of metope pattern in handle zone: four vertical lines with horizontal line and band below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices with figural decoration and 6th century BC patterned chalices usually have groups of vertical strokes on either side of the handles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0940) (phase 2)
